title: Legislative Council Question No. 4 (Written Reply)
question_text:
Date of Sitting: 8 March 2000 Asked by: Hon. CHOY So-yuk Replied by: Secretary for Health and Welfare Question: Will the Government inform this Council: (a) of the total amount of Comprehensive Social Security Assistance ("CSSA") payment granted to non-Chinese persons by the Social Welfare Department, and the number of such cases, in each of the past three years; and (b) in respect of such cases,
(i) of the three nationalities with the largest numbers of CSSA recipients and the

(i) of the three nationalities with the largest numbers of CSSA recipients and the respective numbers of cases involved; and
(ii) of the three nationalities involving the largest total amount of CSSA payments, and of the respective amounts of payment involved?
reply_text:
Madam President, (a) The objective of the
Comprehensive Social Security Assistance (CSSA) Scheme is to provide financial assistance
to people suffering genuine financial distress to enable them to meet their basic and
essential needs. A CSSA recipient must be a Hong Kong resident and has lived in Hong Kong
for at least one year. People whose presence in Hong Kong is unlawful or who are admitted
into Hong Kong for a purpose other than residence are not eligible for CSSA. But there is
no restriction on the nationality of the recipients. The Social Welfare Department (SWD)

no restriction on the nationality of the recipients. The Social Welfare Department (SWD)
therefore does not maintain record on the nationality of the CSSA recipients.
